<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.56</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the object under cursor. This command is quite different from [[cursorTarget]] as it is more precise in determining the boundaries of the pointed at object and can detect a larger variety of objects including map objects and trees. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''cursorObject''' </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[str]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[getModelInfo]] [[cursorObject]], [[typeOf]] [[cursorObject]]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getCursorObjectParams]], [[cursorTarget]], [[lineIntersects]], [[lineIntersectsWith]], [[lineIntersectsObjs]], [[lineIntersectsSurfaces]], [[intersect]], [[checkVisibility]]</value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 23, 2015 - 18:17 (UTC)
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]
<dd class="note">
If you point at the primary weapon of an infantry unit, cursorObject will return the p3d of the weapon instead of  the unit itself (B Alpha 1-2:1.. or its variable name ). That doesn't occur for anything else (backpack or headgear).

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
